verses.roman:
caturbhiś caturo vāhān
sūtam ekena cāhanat
dvābhyaṁ dhanuś ca ketuṁ ca
śareṇānyena vai śiraḥ

synonyms: caturbhiḥ—with four (arrows); caturaḥ—four; vāhān—carriers; sūtam—the driver; ekena—with one; ca—and; ahanat—He struck; dvābhyām—with two; dhanuḥ—the bow; ca—and; ketum—the flag; ca—and; śareṇa—with an arrow; anyena—another; vai—indeed; śiraḥ—the head.
translation: With four of these arrows He struck Dyumān's four horses, with one arrow, his driver, with two more arrows, his bow and chariot flag, and with the last arrow, Dyumān's head.
